thread.title: The most romantic restaurants in Australia
thread.title_full: The most romantic restaurants in Australia - Telegraph

author: Emily Payne
title: The most romantic restaurants in Australia
text: Its vast, varied landscapes yield bold wines and sumptuous seafood and meat. And its sandy stretches, sprawling outback and hidden coves make the perfect places to cherish food prepared by some of the best chefs on the planet. Couples can dine under the stars or at dusk at the foot of Uluru (Ayers Rock), drink champagne overlooking sparkling Sydney harbour, have a slap-up supper gazing over the Great Barrier Reef, or even take a bush picnic in the south among the wild kangaroos. With plump produce picked fresh from the field and world-class vineyards, Australia will leave visitors with loving memories. City Lights Quay, New South Wales For sheer Sydney drama, it has to be Quay: between the Sydney Opera House and the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Star-crossed food lovers can be wined and dined with the kind of cuisine that has cemented one of the city's favourite eating haunts firmly on the San Pellegrino Aqua Panna World's Best 50 Restaurants list. The mix of Head Chef Peter Gilmore's culinary flair, pleasing simple design and immaculate food presentation (try the show-stopping Snow Egg dessert, you won't be sorry) make this elegant dining at its best. Book a table in the “tower”, an intimate area away from the main restaurant with a 360-degree view. • quay.com.au Sheer seclusion Saffire, Tasmania Couples wanting a secret hideaway should head to Saffire, a lavish lodge in one of Australia's most secluded spots. On the edge of Great Oyster Bay, shrouded by Freycinet National Park and the Hazards Mountains, its romantic suites feel totally hidden, while private access through a courtyard means you'll barely see another guest. Head chef Hugh Whitehouse – one of the most accomplished in the country – creates seasonal cuisine inspired by the area’s farming heritage. Foodies can visit the local oyster farm to pluck and eat fresh oysters washed down with a bottle of Tasmanian sparkling wine. • saffire-freycinet.com.au Wine country The Louise and Appellation, South Australia The verdant lands of South Australia make it the country's culinary capital. Step into the wild at The Louise, a glorious boutique hotel in the heart of wine country. At its award-winning restaurant, Appellation, Chef Ryan Edwards sources 85 per cent of the ingredients he uses from South Australia, predominantly from within the local valley. Brave a romantic bush picnic breakfast in the company of wild kangaroos, unleash your culinary skills in a private cooking class, or go wine-tasting à deux with famous winemaker Damien Tscharke. You can even embrace your inner Crocodile Dundee on a one-day knife-making and handling workshop. • thelouise.com.au Romantic reef qualia, Queensland If you want to dine overlooking the turquoise splendour of the Great Barrier Reef, qualia, on the northern-most tip of Hamilton Island, is where to do it. Award-winning chef Alastair Waddell is a whiz with locally caught seafood, dishing up modern, multicultural plates to make any foodie's jaw drop. Owned by the Oatleys, one of Australia's most well-known winemaking families, you can expect a good drop to accompany your meal, too. Stay overnight and choose from 60 private pavilions with postcard views of the Whitsunday islands or the tropical bushland. And for couples wanting time alone, dinner can be taken in their suite. • qualia.com.au Beside the sea Yallingup Beach, Western Australia Surf’s up at Yallingup, known by locals as the “place of love”; where perfect waves and sandy feet meet in one of Australia's most renowned beach spots. The nearby Margaret river is one of the country's most famous wine regions, so pick up a bottle and hit the beach for an al fresco dinner. For a truly romantic evening, go simple: order some battered fish and a portion of chips to share from the local kiosk and savour the much-loved flavours while watching the sun set over the Indian Ocean. • margaretriver.com The big rock Longitude 131°, Northern Territory At Longitude 131°, wilderness-camp couples can experience the ultimate outdoor table for two. Table 131° offers couples authentic outback fare and silver service under the enormous southern night sky. Three courses are accompanied by Australian wine to the sound of the didgeridoo, while entertainers wow with indigenous dances. The opulent lodge offers camping in all-out glamour, with 15 luxurious tents dotted beneath the towering, eerie beauty of Uluru, along with an on-site astronomer on hand to regale guests with tales of the southerly constellations. • longitude131.com.au Discover Australia with Etihad Airways, voted the World’s Leading Airline at the World Travel Awards. Etihad offers daily flights from London, Manchester and Edinburgh via Abu Dhabi to Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane and Perth from just £609 per person. Terms and conditions apply.
